description.narrative: Output 5.1: Election commission of nepal has the capacity to conduct credible, inclusive and transparent elections
seat of a third-order administrative division
seat of a first-order administrative division
seat of a third-order administrative division

1. % of men and women (16+) registered by Election Commission of Nepal with photographs and bio-metric profiling 2. Operational plan for elections developed 3. # of people sensitized on on electoral system and processes through Electorate Education and Information Center at national and sub-national levels 4. New Strategic Plan ( 2015- 2019) of the ENC developed and implemented 5. Inclusive, participatory and credible elections organized 6. Gender policy of the ECN developed and implemented

comment.narrative: 1. As of December 2012, 10.9 million voters registered with photographs and bio- metric profiling 2. Election Commission does not have an operational plan for the forthcoming elections 3. 3000 citizens , particularly youth and first time voters, sensitized on electoral system and processes through EEIC at national and sub-national levels 4. New Strategic plan of the ENC ( 2015- 2019) yet to be developed 5. No data available 6. Gender policy of the ECN to be developed and implemented
1. To support the Election Commission to document the lessons learned an best practices 2. To identify the electoral needs in Nepal to plan the future assistance

1. Assessment conducted on the electoral support and lesson leaned analyzed. ESP supported a review of the 2017 elections documenting the challenges, lessons learnt recommendations for future elections. A study on the overview of gender and inclusion in the 2017 elections was completed with a knowledge product documenting the quantitative and qualitative analysis, advances, identifying gaps and making recommendations for future improvements.
2. Evaluation of the BRIDGE programme implemented in Nepal in terms of its relevance, effectiveness, efficiency, impact and sustainability, completed and recommendations provided for future professional development of ECN and other electoral stakeholders.
3. Discussion held on the future assistance.

1. Continue advisory support to ECN on strategic planning and implementation. 2. Professional skills of the election officials is enhanced. 3. ECNs GIS unit is revitalized and functional with full documentation. 4. High-level interactions on political and electoral issues are supported/facilitated. 5. ECNs GESI policy and action plans are up to date.

1. On the front of strategic planning, ESP provided minimal technical inputs with developing logical framework which was incorporated in third strategic plan. ESP supported translation (into English) and printing of 1000 copies of strategic plan book and handed over to ECN for further dissemination. In order to support effective implementation of the strategic plan, ESP supported development of comprehensive M&E plan which ECN owned. Based on the plan M&E tools/templates were developed and finalized with ECN Secretariat. A consultant was hired to update election history book which was finalized with ECN and 1100 copies of each part-I and part-II were printed and handed over to ECN for further dissemination. These books will serve as helpful reference materials for students/researchers for elections practices in Nepal. 2. ESP is continuously engaging with ECN on strengthening skills of ECN officials as well as stakeholders on BRIDGE and creating pool of BRIDGE facilitators. Due to the COVID crisis, workshops/trainings couldnt happen however, ESP team took a strategic shift and opt for development of online course on BRIDGE module. ESP prepared a concept note with course outline and have it approved by ECN. ESP supported development of ECNs first human resource development policy. A final draft of the policy has been submitted to ECN which is under the process of finalization and endorsement at ECN. 3. On the front of ICT support, in 2020 ESP supported an ICT assessment at ECN hiring an IT consultant. The assessment report with detail plan was submitted to ECN for further actions. In the context of growing use of technology, ESP advised ECN on the concept of paperless office and a concept note was prepared and shared with ECN. 4. In order to support ECN on its mandated role of political party regulation, ESP supported development of political party self assessment software and its guideline. Following series of discussions/reviews at ECN, both guideline and demo of the PASS software is ready to hold interactions with political parties 5. ESP provided technical inputs to update GI policy. ECN held two interactions with stakeholders (one with inter party women network and other with different constitutional bodies). Feedback and recommendations collected from the interactions were incorporated and the GI policy was finalized. 6. ESP supported development of social media policy and civic & voter education policy. ESP submitted a final draft of both policies which are under the process of finalization and endorsement at ECN.

1. Support ECN on drafting of human resource development policy, social media policy and civic & voter education policy. . 2. Develop online courses on electoral administration & management and gender and inclusion. 3. Support ECN in updating Integrated Electoral Management Information System (IEMIS) 4. Support developing Election Operational Plan/Guideline for 2022/23 elections 5. Support ECN on Public Outreach, Civic and Voter Education. 6. Support ECN with external relations. 7. Support to develop Monitoring & Evaluation system for ECN.

1. The project supported drafting of human resource policy, social media policy and civic & voter education policy. Former two policies were already endorsed by the ECN and published on ECNs website. Civic & voter education policy is under finalization. 2. Course content has been finalized for the online course on election administration and management. Project team is working on online platform and audio/visuals. A concept note on online course on GI has been shared with the ECN. Project is hiring a developer firm to work on online platform for GI course. 3. Due to announced election, work on IEMIS is on hold from ECNs side. 4. The project has provided outline for election operational plan and ECN is working on its own on election plan and calendar. After ECN endorse the plan, project will support printing. 5. The project is developing 2D animation video on the theme voter registration and providing continuous support on dissemination of mobile app on election education. The project is supporting ECNs social media engagement and supported 6 posts and reached 55,500 (F:11%) people till the end of May. 6. A draft of ECNs civic engagement policy has been shared with ECN. It will be finalized and published soon. The policy will support longer term strategic civic engagement. In order to engage local government in election management, the project is supporting capacity development of election focal persons (EFPs) at local levels. The project is supporting online information collection of EFPs, training manual has been shared with ECN and under finalization. Capacity building activity will be rolled out soon. 7. A comprehensive monitoring and evaluation plan has been embedded in ECNs integrated guideline on plan and policy implementation and M&E . A system requisition specification (SRS) for online M&E system has been shared with ECN in the vision of online M&E system. 8. In the midst of COVID pandemic, the project has been supporting development of various concept papers, guidelines and directives for ECN: political party dispute resolution standard operating procedure, integrated election code of conduct, political party model by-laws. These papers are under finalization with ECN.

1. EDR operational guideline and resource material on Election justice developed 2. Professional skills of the election officials and electoral stakeholders enhanced. 3. Women, Dalits, people with disabilities, people from backward regions and minorities are capacitated on the democratic participation and civic and voter education.

1.ESP supported ECN in the production of EDR Standard Operating Procedure, EDR Training Manual for Stakeholders, EDR Training Manual for Returning Officers, Political Party Self-Assessment Guideline, World Press Freedom Day Report. 2. ESP supported ECN’s Third Five-Year Strategic Plan by providing support in drafting the logical framework and risk log for the plan. 3. Customized 5 BRIDGE training modules and trained 198 (M: 122, F:76) ECN staff and other stakeholders through 8 BRIDGE modular trainings. 4. As part of ECNs professional development, a pool of certified, skilled trainers was established and 4 (F:2, M:2) accredited BRIDGE facilitators are working among ECN by the end of 2019. 5. The project also updated the ECN information posters on candidate nomination, counting and electoral disputes that it produced for the 2017. 6. 88 (M: 82, F: 6) ECN staff and other stakeholders trained on electoral processes before by-election. 7. An inter-institutional committee finally approved the standard operating procedure for electoral dispute resolution that ESP helped draft in August, marking the culmination of the multi-year effort of ESP to support setting up a mechanism within ECN to handle electoral disputes systematically. 8. ESP worked with 298 CLCs from 31 districts in the by-election constituencies to reach 448 participants, among whom 262 were female. 9. Two EEICs were established in Biratnagar and Surkhet, which ESP supported. 10. ESP supported the training of 819 (M: 493, F: 326) PWDs (people with hearing and visually impaired) on electoral processed. Trained participants cascaded their knowledge to PLWD Students & teachers: 886 (M: 464, F: 422) as well as People Without Disabilities: 166 (M: 87, F: 79) as a multiplying impact. 11. 8 curricula on Social Studies text book (Grade 3-10) updated.
